content: this free pattern is for a simple crochet lace muffler that will fit an adult but can easily be adapted to other shapes and sizes with the instructions and information given please note that the pattern is a first draft and has not been officially tested other than by me if you find any errors or have any suggestions for improvements please message to through ravelry this pattern is for a rather unfashionable item a muffler now whilst the muffler might not be the height of fashion it is the height of practicality and versatility it s the perfect size to fit inside your coat or jacket with none of the additional bulk that you get with a scarf and it can be arranged and fastened or not in many ways this crochet pattern is suitable for a confident beginner and the instructions and guidance have been written with them in mind if you ve mastered basic double and treble_crochet stitches and can work to a consistent gauge you should be able to easily make this note that i use english crochet terms throughout i ve used skein queen s floof yarn in blue oyster colour to make the muffler pictured which makes a soft warm light and airy muffler this yarn is hand dyed in a variety of beautiful colours but being artisan produced it s not easily available you can happily substitute for any lace weight mohair based yarn that you like rowan s kidsilk haze is a good widely available substitution and if you chose to use that yarn you d need 2 skeins for this project it would also be a great project for one skein of the stripe version of that yarn now discontinued if you have one in your stash the advertised gauge / gauge of your sub yarn should be in the range of 18-25 stitches and 23-34 row the instructions in this pattern should create a muffler that measures after light blocking length of 41 inches or 104cm width measured through the middle of 14 inches / 36cm as to gauge this isn t critical but my piece worked up at 3 5 fans to 10cm /4 inches
